author: Jo Craven McGinty
title: The Spillover Effects of State Gun Laws
text:
Researchers at the University of Pennsylvania had a hunch about gun laws: A place with strict laws surrounded by states with lenient ones would have more shootings.
But the data revealed something different.
Counties in states with tight gun laws weren’t affected by the loose laws of neighboring states—but counties in states with loose laws... RELATED VIDEO How Student Survivors Are Fueling a Gun-Control Movement In the wake of the school shooting in Parkland, Fla., that left 17 people dead, student survivors have started a movement for greater gun control. Two students from Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School explain how social media, crowdfunding and political activism have helped spread their message. Photo: Getty Images
